question.questionText: When a seed germinates, why does the root grow first?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The root grows first so the root can take up water for the plant.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Roots sucks in water and makes a seed grow.
Because it is getting water so the young plant or embryo can have energy to grow.
So it can feed the plant.
The root grew because it needs to help the plant stand up.
